TopicTitle: [WIP][1.3.1+] Warbird Cockpits! - 0.3PRE - Mk1 Capsule, Mk1 Inline Cockpit, Mk2 Inline Cockpit

Articles.Content:
15 hours ago, theonegalen said:

RPM and MAS don't store cockpit data in the persistent file

RPM does, I’m not sure about MAS.  But Reviva breaks it.

11 hours ago, JonnyOThan said:

RPM does, I’m not sure about MAS.  But Reviva breaks it.

I thought I remembered losing switch positions when saving and loading, or switching focused craft outside of physics range.

On 9/10/2023 at 10:31 PM, theonegalen said:

I thought I remembered losing switch positions when saving and loading, or switching focused craft outside of physics range.

It’s supposed to work…I revamped how persistent variables are saved fairly recently and simple cases do work when reviva isn’t installed.
I have a slight problem with Mk1 Caged Inline.

On 9/10/2023 at 1:06 AM, theonegalen said:

Just found and watched this video of youtuber @kurgut playing a full mission in the Mk2 Inline IVA! So gratifying to see someone...

Hey ! Thanks for sharing !! I always recommend your IVAs for those looking for detailled and immersive interiors : )

Also very late for answer, was busy with ton of work since a few months... ^^

Cheers

On 11/4/2023 at 12:26 PM, PyjackMeat said:

I have a slight problem with Mk1 Caged Inline.

Yes, that is because I never went in and adjusted the positions for the Caged Inline - it's basically just the same instruments in the same positions as the Mk1 Inline Warbird/Retro cockpit, copied over to provide basic functionality. Honestly, that's a WIP that probably shouldn't have been included in the download, but I didn't do much trimming of unfinished things when I uploaded the last version an embarrassing number of years ago.

On 9/10/2023 at 2:06 AM, theonegalen said:

A couple of bugs too, mostly related to the fact that RPM and MAS don't store cockpit data in the persistent file.

They do. All persistent variables used by MAS and RPM are stored in a save file.

If they don't, something is very wrong.

Awesome mod, you and the rest of the IVA guys are killing it! I have a slight issue though, maybe you or @kurgut might be able to help me.
I recently installed your mod and unlike all my other IVAs they aren't showing up on Reviva, I haven't tested them all yet but when I hopped in the Bonny I'm missing one panel. This leads me to believe it's either a missing prop or it's conflicting with another IVA mod, but the things is I don't think I'm using any IVA modifying mods except ones that Kurgut is using in his IVA playthrough on YouTube. I could be mistaken and for the life of me can't figure this out. Any help would be greatly appreciated, please keep up the great work!

Edit: I just noticed that the engine temp says skin temp and is in Kelvin not Celsius as well, also Raster Prop Monitor isn't on his mod list but its a requirement for Starilex Mk.1 'Needle' Pod IVA. Might have something to do with it, not sure.

Ok so I re-installed the mod completely with all dependencies, but this time didn't change the WarbirdSI.txt to WarbirdSI.cfg , not sure what broke it but just leave the units alone because it'll break the mod otherwise.

https://imgur.com/a/F12Fmog

Edited March 3 by Publius Kerman

9 hours ago, Publius Kerman said:

Ok so I re-installed the mod completely with all dependencies, but this time didn't change the WarbirdSI.txt to WarbirdSI.cfg , not sure what broke it but just leave the units alone because it'll break the mod otherwise.

I *think* with the new version of reviva you should just have both versions available. I’ll check.

On 3/3/2024 at 8:04 AM, JonnyOThan said:

I *think* with the new version of reviva you should just have both versions available. I’ll check.

It's still not showing up in Reviva, but I was having graphical errors with one of the panels in Warbirds. I resolved the issue with the above fix, which i really don't mind because I be's Amer-i-can and prefer knots and feet. I was only using SI to not have to do conversions on the fly. Good news though the airspeed indicator has knots and m/s on it in the smaller prop plane cockpits.

 

I made a really cool stunt plane with the Bonny Cockpit and Merlin engine, only way to throw it into a spin is turn all SAS off and, pull and roll as hard as you can. Just add a little rudder and she rights herself almost instantly. I'm seriously loving these IVAs! Thank you so much for Reviva!

Edited March 5 by Publius Kerman

Did you download it from the github source or did you download the release? Github source is basically a major version change in (excruciatingly slow) progress and will not work.

Edited May 13 by theonegalen

6 hours ago, theonegalen said:

Did you download it from the github source or did you download the release? Github source is basically a major version change in (excruciatingly slow) progress and will not work.

The camera problem in the release version (0.3PRE)
Hmm, without Airplane Plus it works fine

Had the same problem. Turns out in the zip file it starts with  GameData because its supposed to be extracted into the main install folder. I first put it into the GameData folder and ended up having a directory like "...\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\GameData\Galen\..." and after putting the Galen folder into the actual GameData folder so it's just "...\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\Galen\..." it fixed the issue for me. Hope this helps since the IVA's are really good ones.

On 5/19/2024 at 10:05 AM, Minaralwater said:

Had the same problem. Turns out in the zip file it starts with  GameData because its supposed to be extracted into the main install folder. I first put it into the GameData folder and ended up having a directory like "...\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\GameData\Galen\..." and after putting the Galen folder into the actual GameData folder so it's just "...\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\Galen\..." it fixed the issue for me. Hope this helps since the IVA's are really good ones.

I did this as well.

These are hands down my favorite IVA's. However I need HELP!
For PR-1/ Realism overhaul it changes how electricity works and now the cockpits wont work properly because they dont think they have charge. Can anyone link me to a fix?

Edit: Found the fix. In the Part CFG files just remove the text relating to electric charge.

Edited Thursday at 02:47 AM by SheepDog2142
